page.title: 20Government
page.content: The pumping station is administered by Thames Water Authority. Depending on weather and time of year Hungerford's weekly water usage is 8,7OO cu. mtrs. The reservoir is under the pumping station and hold 3/4m gallons. It covers only Hungerford,water is obtained from bore holes in the chalk. The station works on a gravity and booster system. Facilities for the handicapped are available at the John of Gaunt Community centre, Home for Elderly people unable to look after themselves.run and paid for by Newbury District Council.There are 12 residents. Accomodation of 8 single bedrooms.2 double rooms,a loung,dining room,laundry room.toilet facilities for both residents and staff and a flat for night staff. Average age of residents is 9O.Church service monthly
